schemes.name: eCourts Project
schemes.description: A pan-India initiative to transform the judicial system through ICT enablement of courts.
benefits: Online case status and cause lists

schemes.name: Tele-Law
schemes.description: Connects lawyers with citizens in rural areas through video conferencing/telephone at CSCs.

schemes.name: Fast Track Special Courts (FTSCs)
schemes.description: Dedicated courts for speedy disposal of cases related to rape and POCSO Act.
benefits: Quicker justice delivery for sensitive cases

divisions.name: Access to Justice
divisions.description: Focuses on legal empowerment of the poor and marginalized, implementing schemes like Tele-Law and Nyaya Bandhu.

divisions.name: Appointments Division
divisions.description: Deals with the appointment and transfer of Judges of the Supreme Court and High Courts.

divisions.name: eCourts Division
divisions.description: Oversees the implementation of the eCourts Mission Mode Project.

faqs.question: How to check my case status?
faqs.answer: You can check your case status on the eCourts Services website (services.ecourts.gov.in) or using the eCourts Services mobile app. You will need your CNR number or Case Number.

faqs.question: What is Tele-Law?
faqs.answer: Tele-Law is a service that connects citizens with panel lawyers for legal advice through video or audio conferencing, available at Common Service Centers (CSCs) or via the Tele-Law Mobile App.

faqs.question: How to pay traffic fine online?
faqs.answer: You can pay traffic challans online through the Virtual Courts portal (vcourts.gov.in). Select your state and court to proceed with payment.
